post.body: I would really like to know how ZeroNet relates to all those other projects like Matrix.org, IPFS.io, I2P, Tahoe-LAFS and new project on the block: Solid. I sort of "get" what they are doing individually, but I lack the big picture and how they could fit into one big scheme.
I like how Zeronet somehow resembles the 'store and forward' principle of nntp and the good old fideNet and MausNet BBSs. Technically on different protocols of course, but still very similar.

Scientists Find New Way
To Convert Carbon Dioxide into Energy

http://e360.yale.edu/digest/scientists_new_way_to_convert_carbon_dioxide_into_energy/4790/

This will need light, so while this is quite cool, I'm wondering whether the same feat can not already be done with micro algae. Looks like a solution to a task that has already been solved.

There is a lot of buzz about perennial permaculture versus annual cereal production, often with bold claims about productivity. These articles discuss parts of those claims in a very balanced way:

http://smallfarmfuture.org.uk/?p=704

http://smallfarmfuture.org.uk/?p=701

comment.body: @Xiaoxin: I think that when we come up with alternative solutions like food forests and other agricultural practices, we should not over emphazise and overestimate their benefit. Keep it real and keep it credible.
